intro: Crotalaria obtecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain kidney-shaped seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Crotalaria obtecta is also noted for its potential use in agricultural systems due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
